# packages/adapter-rust/vendor/codelldb/win32-x64/lldb/lib/encodings/cp424.py
@source-hash: 30414c2186ea0802
@generated: 2026-02-09T18:10:43Z

## Primary Purpose
Auto-generated Python character encoding codec for CP424 (Hebrew EBCDIC variant). Provides bidirectional conversion between CP424 byte sequences and Unicode strings through Python's codec framework.

## Key Components

### Codec Classes (L9-29)
- `Codec` (L9-15): Base codec with encode/decode methods using charmap operations
- `IncrementalEncoder` (L17-19): Streaming encoder for partial input processing
- `IncrementalDecoder` (L21-23): Streaming decoder for partial input processing  
- `StreamWriter` (L25-26): File-like writing interface (inherits from Codec + codecs.StreamWriter)
- `StreamReader` (L28-29): File-like reading interface (inherits from Codec + codecs.StreamReader)

### Registration Function (L33-42)
- `getregentry()`: Returns CodecInfo object for codec registration with Python's encodings module

### Character Mapping Tables (L47-307)
- `decoding_table` (L47-304): 256-element tuple mapping CP424 byte values to Unicode characters
  - Includes Hebrew letters (0x41-0x71), Latin letters, digits, punctuation, control characters
  - Uses `\ufffe` for undefined/unmapped byte values
- `encoding_table` (L307): Auto-generated reverse mapping from `decoding_table`

## Architecture Notes
- Generated by gencodec.py from vendor mapping file CP424.TXT
- Follows standard Python codec interface patterns
- Uses codecs.charmap_encode/decode for actual conversion logic
- Character set includes Hebrew alphabet, Latin letters, EBCDIC control characters
- Handles undefined mappings with Unicode replacement character `\ufffe`

## Dependencies
- `codecs` module: Core encoding/decoding functionality and base classes

## Critical Invariants  
- decoding_table must have exactly 256 elements (one per byte value)
- encoding_table automatically built as inverse of decoding_table
- All codec classes delegate to charmap functions with same mapping tables
